title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
The ke_search (aka Faceted Search) extension through 2.8.2, and 3.x through 3.1.3, for TYPO3 allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15517
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2020-009
  • https://github.com/tpwd/ke_search/commit/1cde32c3ebfcb6cda5d364f099979be9741f6714
  • https://github.com/tpwd/ke_search/commit/9551aa4eef441a3e9825776d4a19ee4b6fe6f8ea
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gg48-mpp8-cgqc
items.title: [tpwd/ke_search] ke_search for Typo3 XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Craft CMS before 3.3.8 has stored XSS via a name field. This field is mishandled during site deletion.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17496
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/commit/0ee66d29281af2b6c4f866e1437842c61983a672
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/blob/develop/CHANGELOG-v3.md#338---2019-10-09
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f3xr-q258-h7m9
items.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can inject arbitrary Javascript code into the dynamic block when invoking page builder on a product.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8139
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gjjm-4x3g-3h33
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can execute arbitrary JavaScript code by providing arbitrary API endpoint that will not be chcecked by sale pickup event.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8138
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-85xw-3hp5-6fmc
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to manipulate CMS section of the website can trigger remote code execution via custom layout update.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8137
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jrjx-8gmw-jj2q
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to manipulate CMS section of the website can trigger remote code execution via custom layout update.

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can inject arbitrary JavaScript code via title of an order when configuring sales payment methods for a store.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8142
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update

items.content_html:
Spoon Library through 2014-02-06, as used in Fork CMS before 1.4.1 and other products, allows PHP object injection via a cookie containing an object.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-15521
  • https://github.com/forkcms/library/pull/69
  • https://github.com/forkcms/library/releases/tag/1.4.1
  • https://github.com/spoon/library/blob/bda89be80b7e1ffdc93d3180d33a56927430298b/spoon/cookie/cookie.php#L117
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2p2x-mw56-jc98
items.title: [spoon/library] Spoon Library as used in Fork CMS allows PHP object injection

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in LibreNMS through 1.47. The scripts that handle the graphing options (html/includes/graphs/common.inc.php and html/includes/graphs/graphs.inc.php) do not sufficiently validate or encode several fields of user supplied input. Some parameters are filtered with mysqli_real_escape_string, which is only useful for preventing SQL injection attacks; other parameters are unfiltered. This allows an attacker to inject RRDtool syntax with newline characters via the html/graph.php script. RRDtool syntax is quite versatile and an attacker could leverage this to perform a number of attacks, including disclosing directory structure and filenames, file content, denial of service, or writing arbitrary files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10665
  • https://www.darkmatter.ae/xen1thlabs/librenms-rrdtool-injection-vulnerability-xl-19-023/
  • https://github.com/spaceraccoon/CVE-2020-10665
  • https://www.activecyber.us/activelabs/docker-desktop-local-privilege-escalation-cve-2020-10665
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q5rg-wg7h-73m5
items.title: [librenms/librenms] LibreNMS Information Disclosure

items.content_html:
In Centreon VM through 19.04.3, the cookie configuration within the Apache HTTP Server does not protect against theft because the HTTPOnly flag is not set.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17104
  • https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/08/1
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/issues/7097
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j224-7qr4-8646
items.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon Does Not Set HTTPOnly Flag

items.content_html:
In Centreon Web through 2.8.29, disclosure of external components' passwords allows authenticated attackers to move laterally to external components.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17106
  • https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/08/1
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/issues/7098
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/9311
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rx4j-x3fh-9qwg
items.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon Sensitive Data Exposure

items.content_html:
An unauthenticated user can execute SQL statements that allow arbitrary read access to the underlying database, which causes sensitive data leakage. This issue is fixed in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7139
  • https://www.ambionics.io/blog/magento-sqli
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4j6w-9rf8-hg7r
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SQLi Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A path traversal vulnerability in the WYSIWYG editor for Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 could result in unauthorized access to uploaded images due to insufficient access control.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7859
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220127030535/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-24
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqhf-8jgc-h5hx
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Path Traversal Vulnerability
